course_title: Modern and Ancient Tropical Environment Field
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 8 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0 of 6
requirement_designation: Science, Nature and Technology with Lab
class_notes:
(Permission of Instructor Required Prior to Enrollment)


Synchronous class attendance required; timed, synchronous assessments. You must be able to attend a weekend long field trip to the GA coast and a 10-day long trip over Spring Break to The Bahamas, which requires full vaccination.
course_description: Additional tuition is required. Geological, biological, and paleontological examination of terrestrial and marine tropical ecosystems using Sapelo Island. Georgia (required weekend trip) and San Salvador Island, Bahamas (required spring break trip) as field-based case studies. Fulfills intermediate Earth and Atmospheric breadth and upper-level lab or field course requirement for ENVS majors.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 3577, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: M. Hage, Status: Wait List
